column1: #Text=Britain thinks Africans are barbaric , claims South African President
#Text=Jacob Zuma , President of South Africa , claimed Britain believed Africa is " barbaric " , hours before a state visit to Queen Elizabeth II .
#Text=These claims were made after the Daily Mail described him as a " sex-obsessed bigot and vile buffoon . "
#Text=Zuma accused Britons of considering themselves to be culturally superior owing to their past colonial activities .
#Text=" When the British came to our country they said everything we did was barbaric , was wrong , inferior in whatever way .

#Text=According to him , he had never  looked down upon any culture of anyone " and that no one has the authority of judging other cultures .

column1: #Text=Zuma added , " The British have done that before , as they colonised us , and they continue to do this , and it 's an unfortunate thing .

#Text=Mr Zuma had a meeting with British journalists yesterday and was asked not one question about his private life  .

#Text=He also added that Zuma did not  appreciate reading things which he considers are patronising to his culture " and claimed that it was obvious that " his comments will have no bearing on the state visit . "

column1: #Text=The President , according to Magwneya , looks forward to the visit and will continue with the full schedule .
#Text=Meanwhile , the Democratic Alliance , South Africa 's principal opposition party , stated that the reports in the British newspapers did not warrant Zuma 's lashing out at Britain .
#Text=Kenneth Mubu , of the opposing political party said , said :
#Text=" Instead of rising above predictable criticism from a particular quarter of the British press , he has allowed himself to be dragged down to the level of the tabloids .

#Text=By accusing the British people of believing that Africans are barbaric and inferior , he has insulted his hosts , and no doubt undermined the entire purpose of the state visit – which is to strengthen relations between South Africa and the United Kingdom .
